name: Rebecca Dillon
text: Angela was awesome at Bromberg! We have gone to other local jewelers and felt so pressured to put deposits down and buy right away, she found exactly what we wanted when we walked in and never felt pressured! Love this place!

resp.text: Thank you for you great 5 star review and kind words! Angela is one of a kind, and we're lucky to have her on our team. We appreciate your business!

name: Sean
text: Great service from Adam. I read the other reviews and they are bogus. I got a gorgeous watch and was rather annoying about wanting to see almost all of them. Adam was patient and well informed. I really appreciate the service and selection. Thanks!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your great review and kind words. Adam is a wonderful person, and we're lucky to have him! We appreciate your business!

name: Bryan Statham
text: Shannon is the best.  She makes all holiday shopping a breeze.  She is continuously tracking what my wife prefers, so when it is time it is an easy and quick decision.  We have worked with SHANNON for years and cannot imagine a jewelry purchase without her guidance and support.  Thanks Shannon and Brombergs.

resp.text: Thank you for your great review! We appreciate your business and hope to help you again soon! Shannon is so knowledgeable, and we are lucky to have her on our team.

name: Clarke Stallworth
text: I've been going here occasionally since I was a kid. It's what you would expect...a posh outfit with high end jewelry, watches and gifts etc. The people working there are helpful, and knowledgeable, but there is a Mt. Brook vibe that I don't love.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. We strive to make every customer who walks in our doors feel welcome, so we are sorry to hear you experienced a weird vibe during your visit. I hope we can help you again in the future, with positibe vibes only! We appreciate all your previous visits and nice comment about our staff!

name: John Mark Boozer
text: Superior selection and service. Their associates not only are knowledgeable about their products, but also passionate. Simply the best in Alabama.

name: William Parkhurst
text: Shannon was AMAZING helping me get the perfect engagement ring. Took her time and walked me through all of my options. Helped me with design, styles, and even financing. Only one place I buy jewelry and only one person that helps me. Thanks Shannon!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your great review! Shannon is so knowledgeable, and we are lucky to have her on our team! We appreciate your business and hope to help you again soon!

text: I purchased some belts and a wallet with my initials embossed on them. They look great and are holding up very well. Courtni behind the counter did a great job pointing me in the right direction.

resp.text: Thank you for your great review! We appreciate your business and hope to help you again soon!

text: Had a ring repaired. Work was done well and was completed quickly. The  issue I had was a pick up...they could not find my ring for 20 minutes!  and were  very non-chalant about it.... using their Jeweler is fine, but I don't think I would leave my jewelry there for more than a few hours if I didn't have to...

name: Amy Holmes
text: Bromberg & Co is Alabama's go-to destination for fine jewelry and gifts. Manager Brian Hood and his associates are amazing! Knowledgable and service oriented. They are the best in the business.

resp.text: Thank you for your great review and kind words! We appreciate your business and hope to help you again soon!

name: Paige Morrison
text: I grew up always knowing about Bromberg's, so when it came time to start my wedding registry, there were on my list of places to look into. My expectations are constantly exceeded. Not only did I find beautiful items to start making my home with my future husband, there was a wide range of price points (seriously - even truly very adorable ones - don't let the high end reputation fool you) and we were able to find items that reflected our style and our hopes for the future and I feel confident that we chose items we can commit to for our life together. Not only was I please with the selection, the customer service has been impeccable! I feel like the sales associates are always looking out for us and ways to help us more. My experience with them has made this aspect of wedding planning so wonderful.

resp.text: Thank you for your great review and kind words! We're so glad we could help you during this exciting time of your life! We appreciate your business and hope to help you again soon.

name: Jenna Flanagan Dorlon
text: Angela helped me pick out my sisters matron of honor gift a few weeks ago and she was fantastic!! She spent a lot of time with me picking out the perfect gift, and can't wait to give it to my sister on my wedding day! Bromberg's is wonderful!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your great review! We appreciate your business and hope to help you again soon!

name: Chad Graves
text: Shannon was great to work with from the beginning. After the first time we meet, she remembers your name and goes out of her way help make things as smooth and easy as possible. After purchasing an engagement ring, I have gone back for wedding bands, birthday gifts and "push" presents. She nor anyone else at Brombergs ever comes across as pushy or trying to talk you into buying something. She encourages you to take all the time you need. Wouldnt consider going anywhere else for jewelry or working with anyone but Shannon.

name: Daniel Thomas
text: I was helped by Shannon while picking out my wife's engagement ring.  What I thought would be very stressful and overwhelming, ended up being a very exciting and enjoyable process thanks to her professionalism and knowledge of the diamonds.  The entire staff at Bromberg's is very inviting and friendly and I could not have asked for a more enjoyable experience.  Since purchasing her engagement ring, I have purchased two other pieces of jewelry for my wife - she has always been blown away by the recommendations Shannon has made.  I can not say enough good things about her and  Bromberg's - it's the only place I will use in the future and would encourage you to do the same!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your great review! Shannon is so knowledgeable, and we are lucky to have her on our team! We appreciate your continued business and hope to help you again soon!

Outstanding experience. Am new to the Birmingham area and this was my first visit to Bromberg's (the Mountain Brook location). Had to special order a bracelet for an upcoming anniversary. I received excellent customer service from Adam Stoner, who is extremely knowledgable and helpful.

There were several special requirements I needed Adam's help with, which he took great care to address as the bracelet turned out to be absolutely stunning. The price was also very reasonable. I will be back, Bromberg's is now my go-to jewelry store.

text: Swann is the BEST! So very knowledgable and patient

name: Charles C
text: After looking around at many other places in Birmingham for an engagement ring (Diamonds Direct, Levis, etc) I ended up stopping by Brombergs because it was close to where I lived, and I thought I'd give it a try. It was a great decision that I would highly recommend to anyone. The atmosphere is very different than the other diamond retailers I visited. Instead of constantly being pressured to place a deposit on a diamond that was "an incredible deal that is here today and gone tomorrow" it felt more like I was working with a close friend that actually cared about my goals and was willing to answer all of my nitpicky questions without acting annoyed or rushed to try to land my sale and move on to the next customer that came into the door. If I were a new customer that was coming to give Brombergs a try, I would highly recommend working with Shannon. She worked with me throughout this whole process and helped me out more ways than I can count. I enjoyed working with Shannon so much that I asked it she would help me pick out the wedding ring as well as the wedding present. Long story short, Brombergs is a family atmosphere with reasonable prices and ask for Shannon!

resp.text: Thank you for your great review and kind words! We appreciate your business very much. Shannon is so knowledgeable, and we are lucky to have her on our team. We hope to help you again soon!

text: Outstanding jewelry store!  Great selection.  Ashley Smith, owner, always does a good deal.  He appreciates his neighbors.  If he doesn't have what you want, he knows where to find it. I decided to take them back and when I had bought them I payed $15 that was on a gift card and the rest in cash which was $80+. This was already way more money that I was expecting to pay which I also didn’t really have the money to pay that much but I did. So I took them back and got all of the money on gift cards which I didn’t need since the making of the shirts were poor quality. I asked them why this was and all they could say is it was there policy but didn’t tell me anything about it when I payed. I wanted the corporate number but I had already left so I called them and nobody answered it was just a automatic voice. So now I’m sitting here with $100+ dollars of gift cards that I don’t need when what I need is shirts to wear

text: The engagement ring that I had now had for five years kept loosing diamonds every couple of months.  I was so frustrated with this happening. Luckily, every time I went into Kay’s to get it sent off I dealt with the same sweet girl, Elizabeth.  Elizabeth was always very understanding and apologetic.  After about the fourth time of loosing a diamond Elizabeth told me she would talk to her manager to see if they could get me a new ring or just pick out a completely different one.  I sent it off that time and believe it or not, four months later a diamond was missing again. I went back up to Kay’s and luckily Elizabeth was there and I didn’t even have to explain to her what happened, she remembered every detail we had talked about.  I ended up picking out a simple solitaire ring. I hated having to change the ring design but luckily because of Elizabeth’s AMAZING customer service and patience the process was a breeze! Every Kay store needs an Elizabeth in their store!

name: Cara Rigby
text:
HORRIBLE MANAGER NAMED MICHELLE!!!

Worst Customer service ive ever experienced anywhere! Went to Kays about a week & a half ago to look and purchase an engagement ring with my fiance. Starting looking at rings in our budget and was only shown 1 ring which I loved (& the girl who showed us the ring got kinda in trouble for showing it to us) until they said they were having a diamond show & started showing me rings from those cases, apparently they only have a diamond show every so often and I was shown about 3 rings or so from those cases & ended up picking one of the 3 after being felt like those were the only ones in our budget and  I was pressured into it. We were able to get the ring sized that day & take it home.

Skip to week or so later, I decided to just browse online at rings that were in our budget & that said available in store at my local store. Came across several beautiful rings that I was NEVER shown to begin with so I decided to call and speak with the manager who helped us & told her about how I had seen a few online that said they were available in store & in our budget, so I go to the store to see them in person to make sure I didn't pick the wrong ring.
Got there & the manager who from the first visit was super helpful and nice, didn't speak to me once when I entered the store. I showed the girl who was helping me a few rings I seen online that said they were in store & the first ring she said " oh we just sold that ring" the 2nd and 3rd ring I showed her she Said " I don't think we have it" & I was like "why would it say it was in store if It wasnt?" She couldn't give me an answer. She did everything in her power to convince me to keep the ring I had but that pissed me off even more so I still ended up returning the ring which I know they aren't happy about, but I wasn't happy with being pretty much only shown options that benefited them. They didn't treat me the same as the first experience & u just don't do your customers that way. Regardless. I will do everything to make sure everyone is aware of how crooked this place is.

Also, after returning the ring (which was leased throigh progressive) we made an account online to see how the process of the refund was going, come to find out our total was double the price we were told it would be in store from the kay employees. The deposit we put down was suppose to be 79 dollars and would also be the amount of our monthy payment & after looking online we discovered they charged us 86 dollars for the deposit & that our payments would be 91.60 WEEKLY! We were told 79 dollars and some change monthly and then it shot up to 91.60 weekly! They never went over the contract or interest rate with us.

After the return I asked the employee if everything on their end was done and all we were waiting on was the leasing company to do their part. Called the leasing company to find out that they were waiting on KAYS to send the invoice over to get the refund process done & taken care of.

Called Kays once again to speak with the unprofessional, rude heifer off a "Manager" to make sure they sent the invoice in and to try to get some answers as to why she never vocally disclosed with us while signing the lease that our total was actually double the price she told us, & she would not answer the question. All she would say was "you made the return, what else do you need, blah blah.." How they can get away with is beyond me, after asking her multiple times times she actually HUNG UP on us. I called bk & another girl asnwer the phone, I continued to try to get answers we as customers deserved & as I was speaking the girl started pressing buttons on the phone & then hung up on me, incredibly immature & unprofessional. I am mind blown at my experience. I made a complaint with corporate, with the better business Bureau and got intouch with the district manager with the help of another kays manager of a different location!
KAYS IS A FREAKING JOKE, THEY LIE & NEVER FULLY DISCLOSE THE FULL TRUTH & PRICE TO THEIR CUSTOMERS IN ORDER TO MAKE THEIR SALES & COMMISSION!

name: Rhonya
text:
I was looking  for the perfect Mother’s Day gift for my daughter who was expecting her first child. I knew I wanted to get her a necklace with the baby’s heartbeat. After doing some research I came across Mefford Jewelers. I read their reviews and decided that they were the best fit for what I was looking for. I am so glad I chose them. I reached out to them via email and text and Todd got back to me after a few hours apologizing for not getting back to me sooner. We corresponded via phone and text and he really made me feel at comfortable and made the transaction very easy. I wanted the baby’s name and date of birth engraved on the necklace as well, so he waited to complete the necklace until she was born. By the way I threw in a key chain for the dad at the last minute rather than wait for Father’s Day.  Baby girl was born 05/02 and I had both the necklace and keychain by 05/08. I will definitely be using Mefford Jewelers again in the future and I highly recommend them.
Thank you again Todd, it was perfect and they loved them.

resp.text: Hi Rhonya.  Thank you for reviewing us.  We greatly appreciate your kind words and look forward to serving you again!  Please contact us if we can be of further service/assistance and as always, thank you for choosing Mefford Jewelers!

name: Russ White
text:
My fiancee and I visited Mefford Jewelers to look at engagement rings.  Meffords was the first place we visited.  My fiancee lives two hours away from Florence and I was not in the habit of visiting jewelry stores, so I asked friends and coworkers who they recommended.  The number one answer I received was Mefford Jewelers.

We could not have been more pleased.  Toddman Thompson, the manager, spent a considerable amount of time talking with us and making us feel right at home.  He even encouraged us to visit other jewelry stores to see what they have to offer in terms of products and services.  I'm so glad we did.  We saw a lot of nice jewelry and met a lot of nice people, but none that came close to comparing with Mefford.

My fiancee decided she liked a ring at Mefford best of all.  Ironically, we found a ring just like it at another Jewelry store in Florence, but Mefford had a much better price as well as service.  I was thrilled to purchase the ring from Mefford Jewelers because my fiancee and I both know it's top quality at a great price from a family owned business right in my hometown of Florence.

I would say to anyone looking for a jeweler to do business with in the Shoals area - visit Mefford Jewelers.  They will treat you right.  And I believe you will be so glad you did.

resp.text: Hi Russ.  Thank you for the review.  We are proud to be your family jeweler!  For further service/assistance, contact us anytime and thank you for choosing Mefford Jewelers!

name: Mike Kirkland
text: My fiancé had 40 year old ring that had been damaged and one jeweler had already tried to repair it and made it worse.  The band was supposed to have an offset on each side of the setting and the offset had been twisted out of shape when it was damaged. The other jeweler had made it worse and even flattened part of the band in trying to repair it.  We took it to Russell as I had used him in the past and was sure he could help us.  He listened to our description of what the design was supposed to look like and took the ring to repair it.  When we got the ring back we couldn’t believe how good it looked, just like the original design.  We couldn’t tell it had ever been damaged.  I wouldn’t hesitate to use him again as he did a beautiful job on the repair of my fiancé’s ring.

text: Great service that feels like they care for you the customer and the products they sell. It’s like going home and sitting down with family!

name: David Ferebee
text:
Too bad they don’t appreciate long time customers! My wife went in there days before Christmas and asked to have her  charm bracelet cleaned and a new battery for my watch. The watch, bracelet and ALL the charms over the years (20+)were purchased from this store.
She was told “we have not sold those items in years and would not be able to help her today”.
Maybe leadership has changed here from the beginning and relationships do not matter anymore.
I am not bitter, but disappointed that after my many years of buying my wife jewelry from the store it is over.
I am sure I can find another jewelry store in town as I still have many years left to buy for my wife.

resp.text:
David, I'm sorry your wife felt mistreated.  We did have a store full of customers when she was in during the week of Christmas.  We just cannot take someone away from a customer to clean jewelry or change a battery so we do it when we're closed.  As to the Pandora, we no longer have the equipment to properly clean it.  We have not carried Pandora for over three years.

We work very hard to do the best we can, and we're proud of the reviews we receive.  I am sorry you feel we dropped the ball this time.  I do appreciate your review and we will try to be better explaining ourselves in the future.  Richard Frank, Owner

Last month, I brought them my great-great-great grandmother's ring to be resized. Trusting someone to repair a diamond ring that has made it through 5 generations was difficult, but Goldstein's did an excellent job & were very professional. They even discovered two cracks in the ring, repaired those, and kept me up to date throughout the process as well. This is just a great jewelers with a fantastic staff. I highly recommend them!

text: My newest recovery medallion will not fit in the holder plus the link to one half of the clasp was hung up. Angela greeted me promptly and had to help remove my chain. There was no charge for the service and Angela also cleaned my neck chain. I would recommend them to others.

name: Emily Suddath
text:
Goldstein’s helped me and fixed my problems when another local jewelry store failed to deliver the customer service I would expect. I cannot explain what sets Goldstein’s apart until I share the negative experience I had at another jewelry store in Mobile, so I will share that first.

Like I said, I had a ring repair somewhere else first. The other jewelry store not only sized my ring down (when I didn’t ask for it to be sized down), but failed to claim fault for it.  My diamond had fallen out of my setting and I asked the other jewelry store to reset the diamond and also solder my wedding band and engagement band together. When I got my rings back from them, my ring was a size 5 3/4 which is 3/4 smaller than the original size, which was a  size 6 (rings also fit tighter when they’re soldered together, so it fit much tighter than before.) I want to also note that their store never sized me in store either, but rather had the ring repaired with no size listed in their system. Goldstein’s makes a practice of sizing you and placing the size in the system, anytime you come in for ring repairs so that it is never your word against theirs.

When I came back to the other store, not only did they not apologize, they did not want to take apart my soldered rings and resize them individually (so as to protect the integrity of them) , but they recommended making the two rings into one. The sales associate also sized me as a size 7 which is A LOT larger than the size 5 3/4 ring they had sent me home with just a few days before!

I felt something was off with how everything was being handled, so I decided to not have my repairs done there but instead have them done somewhere else...which would be how I ended up at Goldstein’s a few days later.

When I went to Goldstein’s, they measured my finger and reassured me that yes, the other store had sized my ring incorrectly. The rings wouldn’t even fit on my finger without redness and swelling (which the other jewelry store associate said was due to having large knuckles, or perhaps even the humid weather.)

Goldstein’s assured me they stood behind their sizing methods. The other jewelry store actually told me they didn’t guarantee their fit and scoffed over the phone when asked if they guaranteed the fit. Goldstein’s on the other hand, said that they do guarantee the fit they size you with in store. They didn’t make me feel like I was being unreasonable at any step of the way, like I felt at the other store. They affirmed me, as one should do when providing quality customer service.

Goldstein’s measured me as a size 6 1/2  and I noticed they had a careful attention to fit, and also that their ring sizing methods seemed more legitimate than what I was offered at the other jewelry store (they used individual rings to size me at Goldstein’s, and the other store used a keychain of sorts full of various sized rings. I was more impressed with the Goldstein’s method because if you’re getting rings soldered together, you want to see how the two stacked rings will fit your finger and that they come off easily, versus what was offered at the other store, with only one ring being placed on the finger to determine fit.)

If I had gone through with the second round of repairs at the other store, I would have been paying for extra gold that I would have had removed anyway because they sized me as a 7, and my true size is a 6 1/2, as determined by Goldstein’s (my rings fit beautifully now!) Goldstein’s got it right the FIRST time versus the other store which didn’t get it right the first two times.

All this to say, Goldstein’s did everything correctly and professionally. They even texted me to see how my rings were fitting a week later. I call that excellent customer service.

If you want a correct fit the first time with no back and forth issues that make you second guess yourself, and if you’d rather have extra money in your pockets (unlike I do, since I had to pay for correct repairs that the other store failed to provide) then please, go to Goldstein’s!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great review.  We are sorry you had such an awful experience at the other jeweler, but happy we were able to help you.  So glad you are able to wear your beautiful rings again.

name: Georgina Anyidoho
text:
I have never been treated so badly and humiliated like i was at Goldstein's! If only I knew my experience with them later will be so emotionally and mentally traumatizing, I'd have never stepped foot in that store.
I had insisted I'd rather patronize a local business rather than purchase online contrary to what my boyfriend wanted. In the store, I chose a ring that was in the showcase. It wasn't my size so I was told they'd order one in my size, also the diamond for the ring was not kept in the store so i had to wait for over a month for it to come in store. Unfortunately my wedding was called off and so I decided to return the rings for a refund 6 days after purchase was made and three days since receiving it from the store. There is a 15 day return policy for a full refund. I was denied a full refund because as the store owner stated; " Its bad for my business" and offered a 50% refund instead, which i refused. I don't understand why I  should bargain for a refund I'm  entitled  to. When I insisted to be treated fairly and given my refund,the store owner  Richard Frank Jr,  made comments suggesting bias and racism against my color and country of origin.Insinuating I'm ignorant and stupid because I'm a foreigner from another country and had an accent.  I have never been treated like this in any other store environment and urge any other potential customers to beware and steer clear of this rude and racist  business. I find Goldstein's store profession and ethics to be unsatisfactory and many other reviews will state the same. Today I have formally lodged a complaint with the Mobile commerce department and will be taking Goldstein's operator Frank to court.

resp.text: It is unfortunate that we are unable to give a return on special order items.

name: V Bryant
text:
My husband and I have had a relationship with Goldstein’s for more than 37 years.  Prior to that,  my husband and his family had shopped there for more than 40 years.
To me,  Goldstein’s is like an extension of my family.  I am ALWAYS greeted at the door with a smile and they call me by my name.  ( That is an impressive start!) Even though I consider Angela my personal shopper, all the employees are very qualified to offer their services.
I have never been displeased with their service.  The line of products is extensive,  reputable,  and reliable.
Richard is the best “boss man” ever!  He is very soft spoken and polite.  He knows “his stuff!”  Richard can answer any question you might have and find any
product you might desire!
Angela is such a fine and outstanding representative of Goldstein’s.  She always takes the time to ask about me and my family.  She is sincere and genuine.  Angela wants me to be happy!!  And I ALWAYS am very happy and satisfied when I leave.
I cannot day enough about my experiences at Goldstein’s.  I highly recommend them to anyone!!  You WILL NOT BE DISSAPPOINTED!!

resp.text: Thank you, Virginia ;) We love being able to help - that's the most important part of our business!

text:
Having lived in The Mobile area since 1973, I grew up seeing Goldstein's pretty much my entire life. My first recollection was the opulence that was the gilt heavy barred store in Bel Air Mall near the fountain. Through the years I developed an appreciation for really beautiful items.
Not always able to afford, but always with an appreciation, I would stop in to see Richard and his wonderful team.
Fast forward to today, and I now know that affordable is available and BEST PRACTICES in customer care are the norm at my favourite jewelry store in the world.
I love my watches and the gifts that I have purchased from Goldstein's. If you've not been, GO and ENJOY what I know to be true. THIS JEWELRY STORE IS AMAZING!

name: Corey Biggs
text:
Mobile is full of family traditions. One tradition that has stood strong, across the generations, is shopping at Goldstein’s, Mobile’s oldest jewelry store since 1879.

Goldstein’s has an exquisite selection of fine jewelry and watches. You can also shop for unique gifts, that is sure to please that hard-to-buy-for person in your life.

Wether you are purchasing diamonds and gemstones, precious metals, or gift accessories, the welcoming staff at Goldstein’s will be right there to assist you in your selection.

Goldstein’s premier services include jewelry repair, custom jewelry creations, and engraving.

Goldstein gives back to the community with its tradition of sharing, and support of organizations such as; The Boys and Girls club of South Alabama, and Penelope House.

My first purchase from Goldstein’s was 16 years ago with the purchase of an engagement ring.  It was the beginning of my family, as well as my tradition of shopping for family and friend at Goldstein’s.

Make shopping Goldstein your tradition, as Goldstein’s makes service to you, theirs!

resp.text: Thank you, Corey, for being a part of our family tradition!

name: Kaitlyn Parker
text: I had a great experience with Goldsteins jewelry and will definitely go there again. They have a large selection of many top jewelry brands at good prices. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and they listened to what I was looking for and helped me find it without being too pushy. They even were nice enough to offer to clean a ring that I did not even purchase at their store and I've never seen it as shiny and pretty as after they gave it a complimentary cleaning! They answered all my questions and were just so helpful and knew what they wet selling. They have even sent me a personal handwritten post card in the mail to see how I was liking my new bracelet I purchased and to inform me of a upcoming sale they were having. I would definitely recommend Goldsteins jewelry to everyone. They are a very nice helpful and their location is convenient. I would definitely suggest going by and giving them a visit.   I'm sure they could find what you're looking for!

resp.text: Kaitlyn, thank you for the support, and really appreciate the wonderful review. We strive to maintain our relationship with our customers!

name: Dana Carthen
text: Great customer service. I Iove the results of my wedding ring repair.

resp.text: Thanks, Dana!  I'm so glad you're happy with your ring.

name: Mona Wade
text: I love Goldstein’s, o have only been a customer three times total, but it does not matter if your spending hundreds plus, or a mere twenty two dollars, they treat you like your royalty. Angela has helped me on my two most recent visits, one just a purchase of a little over seven hundred, but she listened and understood how much that purchase met and she worked with me to make it happen in a very Speical way. Most recent I was in the store looking for a replacement chain, sterling silver for my granddaughter, who has struggles with speical needs, Angela found the perfect little affordable chain to fit our needs, and even added a little piece of chain, so she could adjust it on her neck, didn’t charge us for her quick fix of placing the small charm on the necklace, that met so much to my granddaughter, I only paid for the small chain and we were out the door, as I was leaving she offered me a water for the road. That is such wonderful service, the kind you don’t get anywhere else. That charm was left at another store for over two weeks, just to be placed on a chain, when it wasn’t ready for my granddaughter’s flight, the jewelry store had a hard time finding our ticket and never seemed to mind, because we were only spending less then fifty. If ever I spend thousands, and I hope to do that one day soon, I will spend it at Goldstein ‘s. Thank Goldstein’s for caring about the person and not the dollar amount, and a special thank you to Angela, a fine representative of the Goldstein’s name. Sincerely, Mona Wade

resp.text: Mona, everyone who walks through our door matters! We look at all of our customers as they are family! I will be sure to let Angela know that you really appreciated her help! She is a great asset to our Goldstein's family!  We look forward to seeing you again soon, thank you so much for the kind review!

name: Linda Kearns
text: Staff so friendly !  Great place to shop

resp.text: We appreciate the kind words - thank you!

name: Chasika Jones
text: Excellent Customer service & high-quality selections!

resp.text: Thanks for coming in and playing in the jewelry!  Bobbie

name: ashley
text: After researching jeweler's who specialized in custom jewelry design, my husband and I were very impressed with the reviews we read about Goldstein's. Unfortunately, our experience was nothing like the reviews.  We wanted to redesign/enhance my wedding set and explained what we were looking for. The store manager took one look at my set and informed me it would cost us more money to custom design a new wedding set using my original stones. She then proceeded to show us settings and told us if we wanted to use my diamond they could put it in one of the settings, made a "joke" that I could have two sets and decide which set I wanted to wear based on the outfit I was wearing. Showed us countless settings then informed us to draw a picture of what we had in mind and bring it in.  Throughout the experience, a price point was never discussed.  We feel the store manager made a judgement call on what we could afford based on my current wedding set.  Needless to say, we left feeling very disappointed.

resp.text: We apologize for your experience, Ashley, whilst an apology will regrettably not alter the outcome or your experience, I do extend it will all sincerity. It is through feedback that we are able to maintain and, when necessary, improve the service that we provide to our valued customers. Is there any way you could call us to discuss? You can reach us at 251-460-9050.

name: Alan Martin

I was told the lady doesn't look at the items  once they are off the machine.Their daughter tried to argue with me and the father wanted to have a screaming match to tell me in so many words that I was wrong in the situation.

Hello,
We are very sorry to hear about your experience. We understand your disappointment. As a family-owned jeweler, we take our clients’ feedback to heart, using it to create new strategies to achieve our goals. Our operations manager is interested in learning more about your experience. Please contact customer@reeds.com to speak with him directly.  We appreciate your honest input and aim to make the situation better for you. We hope to hear from you soon.

text: I went to this store on yesterday 12/18/17, along with my two daughters to purchase their first pandora ring. The salesperson was rude and very impatient. My intention was to purchase two necklaces as well but I didn’t because of the rudeness. I could have been confrontational but I chose to take the higher road and post this review instead. Please know that all the stores aren’t like this and I will continue to shop with Reed’s Jewelry, just not this particular store.

text: TRUSTWORTHY!! I’ve had several people tell me they have used the Shirley’s for years and trusted them with every piece of jewelry. I read reviews and saw one negative review before going. Which was an unusual google account and seemed fake. Remember anyone especially competitors can try and make someone look bad. I went and got my ring sizes and he fixed prongs on my heirloom ring and made it more beautiful than it was!! The before picture is in the kitchen the after is in my car. The turn around time was amazing! They were supper friendly too!

name: Guy Hyfield
text: I have had a couple of necklaces repaired and also a couple of rings sized and have had two rings that the bottom was worn down to the point of breaking the jeweler replaced the bottom shanks  also had a diamond cluster repaired in this way  a week later one of my diamonds fell out he replaced the stone with the same quality diamond true to their word

name: Stacy Warner
text: Very nice owners. Nothing is to much trouble and so friendly!

name: 4ward Nthought
text: SCAM ALERT!!! I went in to have family heirloom wedding ring appraised and he told me the diamond was fake. He tried to get me to buy another diamond from him so he could "swap it for the fake" at the cost of $500. I felt certain my mother would not give me a fake diamond and suspected foul play, so I took it to another jeweler who indeed confirmed that it was real. And just to be sure, I took it to another, and then another. Three jewelers confirmed it is a real diamond but this guy at Sjirleys tries to tell me it's a fake and says I should buy a real one from him and he can "swap it for the fake" diamond in my wedding ring. What a low-down, dirty, evil snake this guy is.

name: Frank Nette
text: In house professional Jeweler on staff with great selection, reasonable prices, friendly people.  Now I got to get a custom designed ring for Valentine's Day.  Thanks Mrs. Shirley

name: Randy Hale
text: Best Jewelry store in Alabama. Shirley and her son Danny have been in this business as long as I can remember. You can trust them.

text: Exceptionally nice people with a capable jeweler in-house. Highly recommend.

text: Lovely jewelry! Sweet staff

name: steven k
text: Good people, reasonable prices.

name: Audrey Smith
text: I had four watches that had dead batteries. I was able to get them all replaced in just 20minutes and it was a great deal at $9 each! They even tried to fix the broken rim on my Oakley sunglasses but weren’t able to weld or solder them properly and they didn’t even charge me.   Will definitely be using them for every future jewelry repair!

name: Marcus Kirby
text: Have had several watch batteries replaced and a ring repaired. Very friendly and affordable.

name: Dave Padgett
text: I have used Jewelry Repair Center for 9 years, to date. Replaced watch batteries, tightened ring prongs, cleaned very valuable jewelry, and sized my wife's wedding ring. All well done, with reasonable prices and within a very reasonable time frame. Nice people. I highly recommend them to you. NOTE: They also sell jewelry!!

name: Harmomy Vollmer
text: Great service. Great price. Fixed a family heirloom.

name: Nestor J. Delgado
text: Careless, irresponsible, poor service. Brought my brand new watch for band adjustment (remove links) and ended up with lots of scratches. Do not recommend.

name: Dana Trammell
text: I got a new Effy ring for Christmas but it needed sizing. It was a 7 and several places wanted to send it off for 3 plus weeks and other places were astronomical in price. I found this place and they do their service in house. It usually takes a couple of days for sizing. I tried on the ring sizes and settled on a 5 but when I tried it on was disappointed and wanted it bigger. I told the guy it was just too tight and I would be glad to pay extra but just needed it right. He asked if a 5 and 1/4 would work and I thought it would. He got me to come back in a couple of hours and it was perfect! He didn’t charge me any extra at all. These guys are very professional, fast, efficient, and know everything about jewelry and their prices are the best in town! Believe me, I went to them all. This will be my go to place from now on. I highly recommend this place.

name: Daniel Flynn
text: Got a watch as a wedding gift a couple years back and have never worn it. Decided it was time, but I had to get links removed. Then found out the battery had stopped. Took it here and they replaced the battery and the links within 10 minutes(was told by another company that I would have to ship it off and it would take 3 weeks or so to get back). So 10 minutes, and 17 dollars later, my watch was fitting and working. Can't beat that.

name: Milton Ware
text: They provided excellent, cost effective  repair service for a band replacement.

text: Great people!  Very honest.  Always helpful.  Highly recommend them.

name: The Stig
text: I have done business with David and Matt many times for everything from removing links from watch bands to sizing rings to replacing lost diamonds. Every time without fail they have been nothing less than spectacular! They are honest, friendly and do very high quality work which they stand behind. They are more than fair with their pricing which keeps people coming back and referring others. I highly recommend them to anyone needing any type of jewelry repair.

name: Ron B
text:
I've used these guys on more than one occasion. Once to replace the crystal and battery on my Fossil watch, and they were also able to polish the links to bring it back to life. Again to purchase two wedding bands, and to have the stone placed in the setting of an engagement ring. And another for the repair of two rings that involved reforming the ring to size and replacing a few stones.

All three times the two guys working the counter were nothing more than helpful. I saw where someone said that they were intimidating. I am 6'5" and the owner was a little bigger than me, so if they were insecure about themselves, then maybe but they were friendly on the phone and in person and talked to me no different than they might a friend. So if personable and joking customer service isn't your thing then maybe they're not for you. But the price was right and the work and service was great.

name: Tina Simmons
text: Great, Great work...Would definitely refer a friend

name: Youlunda Haygood
text: Friendly staff and great prices on repair, batteries, and ring sizing, and very fast. I had an excellent experien and highly recommend them.

name: W.J. Carpenter
text: Let me start off by saying that if you need a watch repaired, look no further than Jewelry Repair Center. With no appointment, I walked in, presented the staff with my broken watch (which they'd never repaired before), and within 10 minutes, my watch was working again. The entire staff is incredibly professional, extremely talented, very pleasant, and eager to serve. I won't say how much the repair cost me, but I will say that their amazing generosity not only surprised me, but completely humbled me (particularly given this strained economic time in which we're living). A big thanks to the staff at JRC; you all really made my day.

name: Jay Dub
text: Huntsville's hidden gem! Unparalleled customer service! Big thanks to Matthew for stopping everything he was doing to assist me! (Been looking for a jeweler to replace my Invicta battery after purchasing the watch well over MSRP at Zales... And of course Zales discontuned support for the watch due to it's size)... Will definitely be returning! A+ business!

Also want to note, Kay and Zales jewelry stores neither could replace the battery without severely damaging the case. These guys have the tools and know how to do the job right the first time.

text: Took a watch in to be repaired.  It was ready the next day (as promised) at the price quoted.  Recommend them!

text: Excellent and fast service. I had to replace the band of my watch and went to several other jewelers. Some were on vacation, some coudn't do it. Jewelery repair center could repair my watch right away. I will certainly come back.

name: Kelly Mattos
text:
In mid-late October 2013 I took my watch to the Jewelry and Watch repair center on University. The owner changed my battery and then admitted to me that he had broken the watch crystal (clear glass over watch face). He reassured me that he would fix my watch. He is a liar, thief and con-artist. In the almost two months that they were “fixing” my watch I went 3 times to try to get any information. Finally I just gave up and told them to give me my watch broken. The owner was rude, impolite and intimidating.
Whenever; I informed him that I wanted my watch immediately regardless of the fact that 2 months later it was STILL BROKEN. He said that he had tried to “make it right” and that he had been looking to buy me another watch from EBAY. The watch I have is a limited edition Android Prism watch that is no longer being made. He said that he had been unable to find any watch similar to mine. While I do not watch a watch from EBAY; I would like to point out that in the last 4 minutes I have found over 5 watches currently for sale on EBAY with the exact same crystal. These are not cheap Wal-Mart watches; he simply did not even try to find a similar watch.
The owner stated that since he had been unable to find a similar watch on ebay (lie) that he would have to send the watch out to Las Vegas to have a crystal custom made. If that was the case then why after 2 months was my watch still sitting on the counter? Why had they not already sent it to be fixed?  It does not take 2 months to drive to the post office. It is apparent that they had no plans on trying to fix my watch.
When the watch was originally broken by the owner, it had a tiny chip in the upper right corner. The watch has received even more damage since it has been in their possession. The original chip has spread to 3 times the size along with a new crack on the upper left. The back is covered in DOZENS of scratches and the hands do not seem to be functioning correctly.
The owner did not even try to fix my watch. He did not even offer a replacement. Under no circumstances should anyone ever go to these people. Now all I have is a broken piece of crap, and no way to have it fixed or repaired. They broke my watch and refused to fix it. These people are terrible.

If mine wasn't a specialty watch, I have no doubts they would have it back up and running in no time since they seemed very knowledgeable.  They even cleaned my watch at no charge.  Very friendly and helpful!

This has happened to other necklaces in the past and I’ve gone to jewelers in B’ham and they repaired it on the spot and charged $0 - 5.     This jeweler said it would take a week to repair it and an estimate of $30 - 40.    I’ve dealt with a lot of high end jewelers, which this one is not,  but my guess, he will not be in business long enough to reach that status with such poor customer service and  attitude.  This jeweler and staff could greatly benefit  from a course in good business / customer service tactics.

text: Redstone pawn has an all around amazing staff and they are genuinely a pleasure to deal with, like any pawn shop you may be low balled at times, but at least these guys are polite and respectful about it, and are usually receptive to negotiations unlike every other pawn shop in the Huntsville area, where it's a take it or leave it attitude. They also have an exceptional selection of brand new handguns and some selection of long guns and also a good selection of used firearms with usually very reasonable prices outside of a pandemic economic environment for firearms. All around my favorite pawn shop, I don't go anywhere else anymore. They even send you text reminders on your phone when your loans come up for renewal about 3-5 days ahead of time. All in all, I've had numerous great experiences here, and I constantly recommend them to everyone who asks.

resp.text: Colin I am very sorry for your experience at our store.  I believe there must have been a miscommunication between you and the associate that was working with you.  We are in no way trying to rip anyone off.  We do our best to value each item and no one is obligated to accept our offer.  We would be happy to give you back the item for the amount we gave you.  Please contact us at redstonepawn@gmail.com if you would like us to remedy the situation.

text: Great store with lots of high quality items. I’ve been in a few times and I will tell you that you’re not going to find any Harbor Freight junk in here. It seems they specialize in buying only the best brands. They also have a wide selection of guns. In my experience most pawn shop employees are quite rude but everyone I’ve dealt with here was very polite with me. And they don’t low ball you when buying things either you will get a fair deal. I have an iPad mini 2 that isn’t in great condition, has a cracked screen, and they have pawned it for me twice for 40$.

name: Misti Daniel
text: If I could leave no stars I would, I used to think redstone pawn was a fair and just business. In the past I've been helped alot by wes and others who work there,  but the way I was treated last month was unfair, shady and down right wrong. A couple of months back I bought a 9mm Taurus hand pistol we did all the proper paperwork and I was approved. In may I got in a bind and went to redstone pawn as I have in the past and got a loan on my gun. When I came back to pick it up  wes made me take another background check and said that I was delayed and to come back in a cpl of days. First off I should have not had to go threw that process again the gun was already mine and I have a receipt of proof of ownership, I was just paying back my loan and picking up my property. When he contacted me back a couple of days later he didn't call he texted me and said i was denied and kept my gun that I have receipt of ownership for nor did he give the full value of the gun he gave me the loan money back mind you I have an expired gun permit. This was a scam to cheat a customer out of money and his property and i want stand for it, I'll be taken more legal action against this business and show them that you can't treat people like this. I was a good customer to them and they handled me very rough and not fair at all, businesses like this get over because as consumers we dont know the law in Alabama you only have to a permit to carry a firearm not to own one. They violated my second amendment right also no way I failed a background check I work for DHR and I passed the first one I took for the gun nothing has changed so why did I fail this time. Because I didn't fail and I've bought guns from Larry's pistol and pawn which is were  I should have stayed I would advise all consumers not to deal with these crooks, know the power of your dollar and

resp.text: Mr. Daniel this review is completely unwarranted.  We are a Federal Firearms Licensed Dealer.  We are regulated by the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms(ATF) and comply with all federal and state laws.  All individuals who are purchasing or redeeming a firearm have to pass a federal background check.  We run all federal background checks through the FBI NICS(National Instant Criminal Background Check System).  If an individual is denied through the government background check we can not release a firearm to them.  We tried to explain the situation to you in the store and give you the proper information to appeal the decision of the federal background check but you were too frustrated for us to help you through that process.  This is a situation out of our control.  We are more than happy to assist with your appeal.  If you are able to rectify the situation with the FBI/ATF we would work with you to get you back the firearm for the price to redeem the original loan amount.  If you are unable to appeal the background check we would be happy to pay you the difference in the value of the gun minus what was owed to payoff the original loan.  We appreciate each customer and their business, we are not interested in taking advantage of anyone.

text: I went there this past weekend and sold a Wii U and some games. Wes gave me more money for it than I expected (including the games) and even more money than I initially *asked* for. I'm not saying you'll have an identical experience, as my particular Wii U was in great condition (as were the games) and the resale value of the Wii U will eventually decrease with the introduction of new game systems like the Switch, etc. But if my experience is any indication, Redstone Pawn will try their best to offer an honest and fair price if you're trying to sell stuff. name: Jessica Washburn
text:
Customer service here is awful. Usually Huntsville is full of awesome helpful people and companies, but you will not find that here.

My 1st experience walking in, I let them know it was my first time in and I wanted to get a matching set of necklace, earrings, and bracelets for my sister and I - She showed me the stones and walked away to the next customer. I had to figure out on my own that I had hanging earring options vs. the studs and also my necklace options.

I recently bought a necklace and earring set, not sure if it was going to go with the clothes I just bought. I even told her this at the register about my dilemma and spent a while in the store figuring out what may work best. The set end up not matching well, so I went today to return. They said it was "final sale" because it was off the discount section, she said, "it even says that on the receipt here and here." SO what! I was not told that, or I would not have bought it. What is wrong with providing a store credit, so the money stays within the store? I just drove a good distance with my tired toddler to do this and you can't help me?

Will not go back again and will find a catalog or something for my jewelry. You have lost a customer, I am sure you don't care.
